If disease befalls one who has set up the (sacred Śrauta) fires, he should leave his home (and go away) to the eastern, or northern, or north-eastern direction. मूलम् ...{Loading}... आहिताग्निश्चेदुपतपेत्प्राच्यामुदीच्यामपराजितायां वा दिश्युदवस्येत् १ 02 ग्रामकामा अग्नय इत्युदाहरन्ति ...{Loading}... ग्रामकामा अग्नय इत्युदाहरन्ति २ Oldenberg ...{Loading}... ‘The sacred fires are fond of the village’ - thus it is said.

If the Āhavanīya fire reaches (the body) first, he should know, ‘It has reached him in the heaven-world. He will live there in prosperity, and so will this one, i.e. his son, in this world.

The gathering (of the bones is performed) after the tenth (Tithi from the death), (on a Tithi) with an odd number, of the dark fortnight, under a single Nakṣatra. मूलम् ...{Loading}... सञ्चयनमूर्ध्वं दशम्याः कृष्णपक्षस्यायुजास्वेकनक्षत्रे १ 02 अलक्षणे कुम्भे पुमांसमलक्षणायां ...{Loading}... अलक्षणे कुम्भे पुमांसमलक्षणायां स्त्रियमयुजोऽमिथुनाः प्रवयसः २ Oldenberg ...{Loading}... 2 2 . A man into a male urn without special marks, a woman into a female one without special marks.

They who have lost a Guru by death, or are afflicted by other misfortune, should perform on the new-moon day an expiatory ceremony. मूलम् ...{Loading}... गुरुणाभिमृता अन्यतोवापक्षीयमाणा अमावास्यायां शान्तिकर्म कुर्वीरन् १ 02 पुरोदयादग्निं सहभस्मानं सहायतनन् ...{Loading}... पुरोदयादग्निं सहभस्मानं सहायतनं दक्षिणा हरेयुः क्रव्यादमग्निं प्रहिणोमि दूरमित्यर्द्धर्चेन २ Oldenberg ...{Loading}... 2 1 . Before sunrise they should carry their fire together with its ashes and with its receptacle to the south with the half-verse, ‘I send far away the flesh-devouring Agni’ (Rig-veda X, 16, 9).

01 अथातः पार्वणे श्राद्धे ...{Loading}... अथातः पार्वणे श्राद्धे काम्य आभ्युदयिक एकोद्दिष्टे वा १ Oldenberg ...{Loading}... 1 1 . Now at a Śrāddha ceremony, at that which is celebrated on the Parvan day, or for the attainment of special wishes, or at the Ābhyudayika Śrāddha (i.e. the Śrāddha celebrated when some good luck has happened), or at the Ekoddiṣṭa Śrāddha (the Śrāddha directed to a single dead person) - मूलम् .

In that moment the gifts of perfumes, garlands, incense, lights, and clothes are offered (to the Brāhmaṇas). मूलम् ...{Loading}... एतस्मिन्काले गन्धमाल्यधूपदीपाच्छादनानां प्रदानम् १ 02 उद्धृत्य घृताक्तमन्नमनुज्ञापयत्यग्नौ करिष्ये ...{Loading}... उद्धृत्य घृताक्तमन्नमनुज्ञापयत्यग्नौ करिष्ये करवै करवाणीति वा २ Oldenberg ...{Loading}... Having taken some food (of the Sthālīpāka prepared for the Piṇḍapitṛyajña), and having besmeared it with ghee, he asks (the Brāhmaṇas) for their permission by saying, ‘I shall offer it in the fire,’ or, ‘I will sacrifice my offering in the fire,’ or, ‘I will offer it in the fire.
